Detailed Description

Programme Execution.

Functions from this header are used to execute other programmes and to query a child process's status.

Define Documentation

#define EXEC_CALL_NO_IO   0x0001

Flag for exec_call->options: Do not create a stdio Connection.

#define EXEC_CALL_PURGE   0x0002

Flag for exec_call->options: Purge open File Descriptors.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum process_status

Description of a Process's Status.

Enumerator:
ps_running  Process is still running.
ps_terminated  Process has terminated.

Function Documentation

void check_exec_context ( struct exec_context *  context  ) 

Update an exec_context Structure.

Parameters:
[in] context The context to update.
This function will basically perform a wait() on the child process described with the given context.

struct exec_call* create_exec_call (  )  [read]

Initialise an exec_call Structure.

Returns:
A new exec_call structure.

struct exec_context* execute ( struct exec_call *  call  )  [read]

Execute a new Process.

Parameters:
[in] call The structure with parameters of what to execute.
Returns:
A new exec_context.
After calling this function, the given call structure will be invalid.

void free_exec_call ( struct exec_call *  call  ) 

Free an exec_call Structure.

Parameters:
[in] call The call to free.
This funtion should rarely be needed, as execute() will already free the memory associated with its parameter.

void free_exec_context ( struct exec_context *  context  ) 

Free an exec_context Structure.

Parameters:
[in] context The context to free.
This should only be called after context->status has the value ps_terminated as after the context has been freed, it is impossible for the process to perform a wait on that child process.
